website_summaries.verdict: Providing a handle for extra grip, this efficient harness is equipped to support extra-large dogs.
pros: Extra-large harness can holds dogs up to 200 lbs
Harness straps saved many owners from experiencing back pain
cons: Dogs can slide out of harness if the product is the wrong size

customer_reviews.title: I Am So Glad It Could Be Express Shipped
customer_reviews.text: I have a boxer who is about 71 pounds. I initially thought this was supposed to go around the CHEST and RIB CAGE girth, but my vet told me it is actually supposed to sling under and in front of the dog's hips. I thought this would be less secure until I tried it. So the good news is, even though I bought a size too large thinking I needed it for her Boxer-girth, it still works on my dog who has a torn ACL and hip displasia. She is able to get up with my help, and even take short walks as we prepare for her surgery. This will be a huge help after her surgery I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: KJB

customer_reviews.title: Its a bit challenging if you dog has a larger ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a bit challenging if you dog has a larger rib cage and has short or longer front or back legs , but were going to use it for my italian mastiff , to help her walk up our long set of stairs in the house , just takes time to get use to using it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: There is two reasons why I wouldn't recommend this product. #1 It doesn't work for my GSD , Its slides down to his penis area and it hurts him when trying to lift him. #2 and the MAIN reason is that You can not return it for a refund. so now I am stuck with something that doesnt even work for my dog. I purchase this so I could help my dog down the stairs following his ACL surgery, but it doesnt work for him. It says Vet approved... Whose Vet?? When my Vet saw this item, he immediately knew it wasn't going to work for my dog. I tried it on my dog and the Vet was right..
customer_reviews.author: pdog

customer_reviews.title: She has horrible mobility problems including stairs and getting into car
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in July 2017. I have just ordered another one. It is used everyday to get our 13 yr old Pitt/Lab mix down and up stairs. She long ago had an ACL reconstruction. Now she has severe arthritis, going to physical therapy at our vets every other week. She is approximately 82 lbs. Her ability to get in a car and stairs would otherwise be impossible. Ordered an X-large which just fits over her broad chest. Ordered another one because the first is just starting to wear at the straps. We have used it for over a year and is only now just starting to wear at the straps. The new one comes tomorrow. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: No!!  It slides around yet fits her chest perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I would have much rather have a dog lift vest than this harness!!!! It kept sliding to her back legs... the one she had the surgery on!!! It fits!! it is the perfect size for her chest circumference..... but can slip and slide around. A dog vest is better. I need to return this and get the other. I need one that does not move when I assist her in going up and down stairs! So frustrating, and yes it is on tight! Ruffwear makes better products. I bought this instead..
customer_reviews.author: K R TTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not fix large breed german shepherd
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get this completely around my male German shepherd. CANNOT USE snaps or close it around him cannot return as it was covered in Dog hair.It is to small for an XL to fit around stomach or belly ribs of my dog.He is 11 and hind legs have gone lame and really need to assist him but I spend more time trying to hold onto this sliding down where he peas because it wont close shut so found I bought something to small but now covered in dog hair and cannot return because XL dont fit it's too small
customer_reviews.author: gummybear

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to put on and adjust... Helpful for dogs that struggle with their hind legs
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, if you're considering a product like this than I'm sorry that your dog is going through a hard time. Okay, having said that, if you need a harness to help your dog stand, this is a good one. I tried a couple other ones before this and the dog lift harness is easier to put on. It's priced right, it's strong, it's available in a size large enough to accommodate really big dogs like my Akita.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This made a difficult situation so much easier. Recently our elderly dog suddenly lost the ability to use her rear legs, and we were at a loss for how to help her be more comfortable and mobile. She would whine loudly if we left her in another room from us, but she also hated being carried. After several days of trying other options, we found this sling, which was the perfect solution for her. It gave her just the right amount of mobility during her final weeks, allowing us to help her go outside, and move from room to room with us. Still a rough time, but this sling definitely made it much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Harness CCL/ACL Lift Sling-Not For English Bulldogs
customer_reviews.text: Dog Harness CCL/ACL Lift Sling. Had to return this to amazon. My dog slid right out of it. I tried a few times, wouldn't work for her. She had TTA surgery for a CCL repair. Can't afford to have her slip out and hit the ground. I appreciated the email from the owner of the company, that was a nice gesture. I appreciated that. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: D. RZONCA

customer_reviews.title: Used for an 83 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Velcro holds, but just barely when helping the dog up. Tries to pull apart. The whole thing tends to slide on the dogs underbelly, even when tight around the dog. The handles hold, but the thing to tie them together is useless--about an 1/8" of Velcro to hold it around the straps, so it does not hold or even fasten around them. It is supposed to have snaps to roll up for storage, but the two parts of the snaps are assembled wrong, so there is no way to snap it.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very well-made but straps could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd. This is very well-made, sturdy, and padded for comfort throughout the body piece. He is very comfortable while wearing it. I, on the other hand, am not. He weighs 80 pounds and the straps are very thin, 1" webbing that cut into my hands while I am holding him up. I added a piece of yoga mat, taped around the straps, to solve the problem. Either thicker straps or a padded handle would make this a 5-star device.
customer_reviews.author: MPMP

customer_reviews.title: Slips to the front, not helpful for hind lameness
customer_reviews.text: Item was quite large, and while I thought this to be somewhat helpful, there could be some improvement. My dog is about 55 pounds and very senior who needs help with her hind legs. Every time I’d put this on, the harness would slide to her front rib cage. Would definitely wen more helpful if there were straps that kept this from slipping to the front. Overall it was not very helpful for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: queenbeeisme2000

customer_reviews.title: Works ok for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have a large Mastiff that has bad knees in both rear legs. I have purchased 2 custom made braces for her and I bought this harness to help hold her up while she is learning to walk with the braces. It just fits around her large torso and I can hold her back end up fairly well with this harness, the reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because the material is a bit thin and bunches up just in front of her rear legs at times. If it were more sturdy, perhaps reinforced with neoprene or something, it wouldn't bunch up as much.
customer_reviews.author: The Toolman

customer_reviews.title: Godsend for Dogs with Mobility Issues, Lightweight & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This harness sling has been a Godsend for my 11 y/o Irish Wolfhound. He started having rear leg/hip mobility problems 2+ months ago. There was a very short learning curve for him to get used to using it. At first the Velcro startled him, but he used to it. The XL size, while may support his weight, doesn't quite fit his frame nor sit where it should (as in the picture), but nonetheless, it works getting him up/down the stairs and on uneven surfaces. It has to be removed for him to urinate, but this is not a problem for him.
customer_reviews.author: MMC07

customer_reviews.title: GreaT for recovering dogs
customer_reviews.text: We got this when my 65Lb pitt had TPLO (knee replacement) surgery. It helped with the recovery greatly. It helped let her use her back leg but not put to much weight on the healing leg. It also allowed me to help support her when she used the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: the Tildens

customer_reviews.title: Nice material...a few tweaks would make it 5-star
customer_reviews.text: Product seems well made. Good quality materials. Fits a little on the smaller side. Much dog is a 102 lb American Bulldog and this is very snug (size XL). Only improvement I’d recommend is a chest strap. I find on the first few walks in the yard that the sling slides all the way back to my dog’s hips, making going to the bathroom a chore as I need to adjust or remove. I think a simple chest strap could be easily integrated to the design with little added manufacturing cost and it would increase the functionality in a way that would certainly be worth an extra $5-$7 to the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Hay

customer_reviews.title: I especially like the straps which are a great length and are ...
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador was injured recently and needed assistance getting around. My local pet stores did not carry any type of sling so I found this one on Amazon, it has bee incredible! It makes taking him outside so much easier. He weighs 80 pounds so picking him up is not an option. I especially like the straps which are a great length and are adjustable. I would definitely recommend this dog lift harness!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, I got a product that had been returned. I was not pleased that I received a product that was covered in dog hair, but since it was just going to end up covered with my dog's hair, I tried not to mind too much. Maddie is a 100 pound lab and the XL barely fits around her. Even though it's snug, we only have to use it for walking on the linoleum at the vet's office. She has bad hips and is scared to walk on slick surfaces, so this gets the job done. I'm not sure it would be comfortable enough for daily use
customer_reviews.author: NPwendy

customer_reviews.title: Measure your dog's girth.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cancer stricken Rottweiler, Bella. I failed to measure her girth. I assumed she would have fit into the XL size because it went from 75-200 lbs. Bella was 110 lbs. It did not come close to fitting her. The harness looked well made, but I can't really comment on the quality since it was never used. So be sure to check the dog's girth. Sadly, Bella is no longer with us. I wish it had fit, as it would have been very beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: kine97

customer_reviews.title: Great for older dog.
customer_reviews.text: My older dog was unable to get up in her own because of arthritis. She's 100# plus and I couldn't lift her myself. This belt was exactly what I needed until she was able to get up on her own. Feel confident using it with no worries about straps giving out. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately a no.
customer_reviews.text: This is very well-made. But it's slippery and doesn't stay put. It slides all over the place and really isn't helpful. The handles are sturdy, but there's no way to keep this sling on your dog without it slip-sliding all over the place and feet and legs getting tangled in the handles. I need something that can stay on my dog while traveling to the vet or the park. This wasn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and designed.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very well made. Sturdy and strong. Originally was planning on returning as the width is narrower than expected, but was able to utilize one with our pups chast harness until his body harness arrived. The second one we are saving for our three medium to large size pups, it fitted them well. Our GSD is a very tall and long GSD, weight on the low-normal to norma range. Thank you very much for a well-made and thought out product.
customer_reviews.author: lsylvia

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for a Large or XLarge Dog
customer_reviews.text: This sling is not wide enough to help large or weighing more than 75+ pound animals (dogs) with a lift assist. The sling only offers small section of lower quadrant coverage for the back legs. The straps are not made to support the weight of a truly large animal (110+ pounds). The large would be suitable for a lift assist for animals less than 50# who do not need to be secured by the Velcro wrap.
customer_reviews.author: GroZen

customer_reviews.title: Not Strong Enough for Large Breed Dogs.
customer_reviews.text: The sling is too flimsy and not sturdy enough to use on larger breed dogs. I have a 104lb Rottie and I wasn't able to use this at all. I needed it to help lift her into my SUV because she had not one but two torn ACL on her hind legs.
customer_reviews.author: SassySarah

customer_reviews.title: Using it for an elderly Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: This gizmo helps us get our Great Dane up and down the stairs and off the floor when he can't stand on his own. The vet also found it useful when they needed to give him a checkup.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product and great assistance for our dog..
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly!! Good quality and just as the picture shows. Our dog has very bad hips and this is a big help for us when she has to go down steps. My dog thanks you.. We thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurafhl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for mid to upper spine issues, and better suited for female dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as my dog passed away before we could use it. We did however, try it on and lift hi, with the harness sling. Believe it would work better for a dog whose weakness wasnt the rear most oount of the spine, and better on a female. Squished my Apollo without rearranging.
customer_reviews.author: mrswhit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect “help up” for my 100# dog
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my aging German Shepherd. She doesn’t mind the little help up with this. Very strong as my Dog weighs 100#
customer_reviews.author: Katzapainter

customer_reviews.title: I'm sad to be having to use this wonderful product again ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sad to be having to use this wonderful product again with another dog entering the geriatric year's. Very helpful for arthritic dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I can easily slip this under her stomach to help her get ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted. Have a 10 year old Saint Bernard who has arthritis. She can walk and run but has trouble getting up. I can easily slip this under her stomach to help her get her rear legs up. It is a great width for a larger dog though would be fine with smaller dogs. It is exactly what we need . Came within quickly too
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Velcro and handles.
customer_reviews.text: This fits across the dog but there seems to be some overlap. Also easily slips to the bottom while arranging it. A little awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Powell

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETURNABLE - BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This harness is way too big for my dog, and it's not returnable. BUYER BEWARE - I buy casually on amazon because I can return something easily if it doesn't work, but with this, it's not the case. If you really want to buy it, contact me and I'll sell you this one. (insert me rolling my eyes here)
customer_reviews.author: Nic Yo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Only used it one time before I had to return it, dog required surgery. But very sturdy and strong. Our dog weighed about 75lbs. Return process was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works as advertised. The only suggestion I would make for this product is to have shorter handles. One of my friends helping take care of the dog is not as tall as I am and he had a hard time trying to wrap the hands around his hand and also lift at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark 🐕

customer_reviews.title: and this harness indeed was very useful to assist my dog move around after surgery
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the product. My dog is 150 pounds, and this harness indeed was very useful to assist my dog move around after surgery. The material is sturdy and of great quality. I would definitely recommend this product for other pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: The harness is very well made and it works great. My dog has terrible arthritis and hip dysplasia ...
customer_reviews.text: The harness is very well made and it works great. My dog has terrible arthritis and hip dysplasia and the harness took enough weight off of him that he is able to walk with me and not be in the same pain he is in without. I am so glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my 12 year old lab. He has arthritis and just started having trouble going up the stairs. Very easy to use. I just slip it under his chest and velcro it shut on top and grab the handles and we are ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: judy

customer_reviews.title: Harness Help tremendously
customer_reviews.text: Item helped tremendously with the struggle of walking around after my German Shepherd had a back issue that caused him to have weak spells in his back legs and was to old for surgery, so we would go back to the vet every two weeks for checkups. It was a little hard to keep in place on him because he figured out how to get it to slide off of him. We still took smaller walks up to the day before he passed in his sleep from old age.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Received and looked at it was pictured but was very challenging to use. It does not stay in place, my dog is about 80lbs and is loosing the use of her back legs due to age. We have been using a towel to help her but thought it would be easier on us and more comfortable for her to buy this product. Does not work well and slides all around when you try to use it. Also the handles are too close together so for a larger dog you have no leverage to help her stand. Would not recommend. Towel works better and they do not accept returns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my older dog. It really helped after his surgery but we still use it for him to get up the outside steps.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and comfortable for your dog.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Very comfortable for our 15 year old black lab mix and helps significantly as his back legs are getting weaker and weaker. Thank you for such a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Ccinweave

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit dogs up to 200 pounds like it says!
customer_reviews.text: Not large enough. I have an old, large lab with arthritis. I really had high hopes for this, but it def does not fit as large a dog as it states. I would say maybe 75 pounds max...unless you just have a very tall dog. Bummed out as it says I cannot return it, so it was a waste of money :(
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. Sturdy and easy to use. I got the x-large for my sisters dog who is about 70 lbs and it’s roomy.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog Chick

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the largest size and it wouldn't even go around my 100 lb labrador retriever. Materials are cheap. No padding in the hand grips. Far too expensive for quality of product. I Suggest you find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Remeneski

customer_reviews.title: Need shorter straps!
customer_reviews.text: Taking off one star because even with the straps as short as they go, they are too long for me. I use this for one our senior great Danes and he’s realllyy tall- so the length of these straps doesn’t work well for us. Need a shorter option!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It was just what we needed for our older soon to be 9 year old German Shepherd; we use it with the ramp in the car;
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: This was a good aid to our old female Lab, Trixie.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D Gogolowski

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for any pet that has had ACL repair surgery and needs a helping hand!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Langevin

customer_reviews.title: Fur E Frenz lift harness sling
customer_reviews.text: Lift harness is well thought of for ease of use. Our Bernese Mountain dog weighs 90 lbs with hip displacia and she appears to not be in distress when this is used to assist her with getting into vehicle
customer_reviews.author: bert barrett

customer_reviews.title: Worked good.
customer_reviews.text: bought for my brother's dog after she had surgery. Helpful
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Great product .
customer_reviews.text: Great product , put it to use the day that it arrived .
customer_reviews.author: rayford r. hiatt

customer_reviews.title: This works on a 80 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the dog we got it for is 125 lbs and it is too small.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Help your pet and your back and neck with this harness !
customer_reviews.text: My lab tore her ACL. She will have surgery and needs support to walk and use the bathroom. This harness is a big help. It is helping her to walk and saving my neck and back
customer_reviews.author: SEW

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: The double straps are the worst! Very confusing to use.
customer_reviews.author: JKH

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great value..
customer_reviews.text: I have a Burmese and this works perfect and is very sturdy and easy to use...
customer_reviews.author: lindy yutzy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Aging Dog
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Got this for my aging dog to help him in and out of vehicles, etc. Easy to use. Just remember, they cannot urinate while wearing or you will have one messy sling!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet but it looks sturdy and should work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: I have an older German shepherd that has lost mobility in her hind legs. This works great in providing a method to hold her up , so she can go outside to take care of business. Velcro is strong and holds well.
customer_reviews.author: emidkiff

customer_reviews.title: Not for basset hounds
customer_reviews.text: My dog slides in this thing and she got scared so can’t use it - it doesn’t work for my basset hound
customer_reviews.author: MInDel

customer_reviews.title: The product is pretty simple to use
customer_reviews.text: The product is pretty simple to use. Unfortunately it doesn't fit all the way around to use the velcro for our dog. We purchased the XL for large breed dog over 100 pounds. It still helps us immensely in assisting our St. Bernard up the two steps we have.
customer_reviews.author: Ahint1457

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. My 100 lb dobie lost his rear leg. I have no problem lifting his rear up stairs with this. Only wish it had more padding for his underside. Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: adriana mazutis

customer_reviews.title: I tried it and it seems to work good. Luckily I have not had to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried it and it seems to work good. Luckily I have not had to use it because my dogs surgery went great. But now I have it when and if I will need it.
customer_reviews.author: clstans

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply constructed. The straps are way too long, and not adjustable. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: GaryPen

customer_reviews.title: Great after ACL surgery!
customer_reviews.text: After my dogs acl surgery my vet wanted to sell this to me for 2X the amount. This worked great and made taking my dog out so much easier and gave me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect helper!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my large, aging, arthritic dog with hip troubles. He occasionally needs a little help and this has been perfect! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and speedy delivery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and speedy delivery! I will have to paint a rubber coating on the inside to keep it from slipping down her back, but the product idea is good.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hyman

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my older lab but it does begin to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my older lab but it does begin to move down after a few hold ups when he begins to fall. I just re-adjust and he's ready to walk more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a harness that feels good on my elderly dog
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy material and I like the handle, which will help my grip when I use it. Looking for something so well made for a while now. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Karen Berger

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to wrap around dog and straps are a good length. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: I was able to lift the back legs of my 85 pound dog after surgery and will continue to use the sling for another 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: The harness helped me tremendously. My dog had ACL surgery and I have to raise his back legs when we go outside. The sling helped me raise his back legs going down 2 steps to take him outdoors and then using the sling again when returning indoors. Only complaint is that the snap and its connector were useless since they were put on the same side and could not be used, I would have returned the sling but It was imperative that I use the sling when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Miller

customer_reviews.title: this does not stay in place on the dog's middle
customer_reviews.text: This item is very well made using good materials.The band does not stay around the middle area, slides back to the hind legs. This would be perfect if there was a way to keep it in place, without having to undo and redo placement.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: This was a back saver for me and a life ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a back saver for me and a life changer for my 10 year old , 85 pound lab. She has hip issues and it happened so fast there wasn’t time to shop around. I was able to order and have it the next day. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda J Wright

customer_reviews.title: Lifts those heavy hind legs...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. The vet was glad to see I bought it to bring my BIG Baby home...
customer_reviews.author: R W Charles

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is horrible. Would cause harm to my dogs stomach. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was well made and strong enough to help lift my 75 lbs "baby".
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Oyler

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: really worked well for my dog which needed it as he aged. good quality, long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: When my dog started having health problems, I was able to carry him and handle him myself. When I wasn't around my older parents where able to walk him with this sling.
customer_reviews.author: Tan-ReViewer

customer_reviews.title: So good
customer_reviews.text: Great sling for my lab. It helps me and my husband lift him up in the truck
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Y Beck

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong & Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Great product ! Wish you made an XXL. We bought the XL and it was still a bit too small for our big girl but keeping it and adding on some more material (neighbor a seamstress) The product is very well made!!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Slips too much
customer_reviews.text: Item does not stay It slips past dogs stomach towards his rear legs , can’t control very awkward
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Bollitier

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for seniors and arthritic dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior arthritic, epileptic and diabetic dog who needs help some days getting up stairs etc. This makes it SUPER easy to help my baby and doesn't bother him at all! This really helps make the arthritis and spondylosis much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my lab who has arthritis in his spine
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my lab who has arthritis in his spine. Was a little difficult to get under him since he is a 70lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Beckkers

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Straps too long so I couldn't lift my Baby girl. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: tara Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great product, good value. Hard to get under a heavy, hairy, old dog. But definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: maidenN

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for slings
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. It's easy to put around the dog and feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Check to see if size will fit your dog.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it was too small for my great pyrenees. She is 101 lbs. and the XL is too small & not available in a larger size.They did offer a refund but since it was full of her hair I did not send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Janet P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for our dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog responded well to using the sling. It is easy to put on. Helped our older dog maneuver steps.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S. Gresh

customer_reviews.title: Best item for job
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is 180lbs. HaS hip issues. This item really helped up pick him up and help him walk.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie RoXanne Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much. Because of this product my German Shepard could come home today ;-)
customer_reviews.author: stormywolf013

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can get along without it. Be sure to measure your dog before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was hoping for a little better quality.
customer_reviews.text: The product was okay. Have to return it as it is too big. My dog didn't like it and wouldn't wear it. Also i found it cery difficult to lift a 100lb dog.
customer_reviews.author: Who

customer_reviews.title: Made well and very easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Made well and very easy to handle... my Labrador has hip issues and this product is very useful to support her when needed. I would recommend this to any dog owner as an additional support to help care for your animal at time of need.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Easy and very helpful lift aid
customer_reviews.text: We had tried other lift assists This one is easier and works very well to aid our very old fairly large newfy up. We use it now when we walk her too!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Fits well and easy to use. Very well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Helpful with an injured dog
customer_reviews.text: This was very helpful. I have an 80 pound Golden Retriever that had a torn CCL (similar to ACL in humans). The sling helped us before and after her surgery. I used it to help her in and out of the car for vet appointments.
customer_reviews.author: L. Witham

customer_reviews.title: Great assist tool
customer_reviews.text: Helped save my back for 112lb Rottie mix. Easy to put under him and assist him while he gets up. His back legs are very weak and this helps get him outside. He is a little larger around the rib cage so the Xlarge is a bit snug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We used this product to help lift our 85 lb. lab when her hips failed. It worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in place, it slides back to rear legs
customer_reviews.text: There is no way for this harness to stay in place - it continually slides back and bunches up to the rear legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my dog a lot of pain; he’s very grateful.
customer_reviews.text: Would have preferred grip handles, but it does the job! Saved my dog a lot of pain; he’s very grateful. Thank y’all!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Kay

customer_reviews.title: Better than picking her up and much safer for both ...
customer_reviews.text: Using it for a 13 yr old 87# lab mix. Both her and I are still getting used to it. Better than picking her up and much safer for both of us. A better design on the strap pad is needed. The oval is difficult to wrap and fasten. Maybe a squared off pc. would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Fur E. Frenz Dog Lift Harness Sling | ACL Brace for Rear Leg Support of Old K9 | Help Em Up Carrier Knee Limping Joint Hip Injuries Arthritis Poor Mobility Veterinarian Approved
product_meta.description:
Size:Extra Large| Color:BlackRECOMMENDED BY VETERINARIANS

No one likes to witness their dog in pain, imagine being able to help them recover quicker so that they are back on their paws in no time!

X-LARGE SIZE - Ideal for dogs measuring between 28 - 33 inches in Girth and weigh 75- 200 lbs

Measurements: Dog lift support pad is 37.8’ long X 9.4’’ wide

Features and Benefits: 
✔Best Value - Includes 1 Dog Lift Harness, A Step-By-Step Instruction Manual on proper use, and a FREE bonus GIFT from us with every purchase! 
✔Machine Washable - Simply throw the Dog Harness in the washing machine for quick cleaning, let the sling air dry. Do not machine dry. 
✔Strong and Durable - Your pet is family, We use only the highest quality material and test all of our products in the USA to guarantee strength and longevity

Perfect for: 
✔Elderly Dogs 
✔Weak hind legs 
✔Orthopedic injuries 
✔Arthritis Pain 
✔ACL / CCL Tears and More!

*NOTE: Measuring your dog’s body measurements before ordering the sling is recommended in order to avoid ordering the wrong size. It is important to purchase based on chest measurements not weight.

BUY WITH CONFIDENCE - 100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE

Click 'Add to cart' now to restore your best friends mobility and consider picking up an extra for your family or friends pets!
feature_bullets: DOG SLING - At Fur E. Frenz (A TheraCool Brand), We help your family friend walk, climb, and live a normal life again after suffering from degenerative myelopathy , hip dysplasia , ACL tears or other debilitating hind leg ailments.
DOG LIFT HARNESS SIZING: EXTRA LARGE SIZE (BLACK) is Specially Designed For Extra Large Breeds With Hind Leg Mobility Issues. XL size fits girth between inches around the belly area.

ADJUSTABLE LENGTH STRAPS - Unlike our competitors, the Fur E Frenz sling has adjustable length straps and an Anti Slip design. No more bending over! MACHINE WASHABLE – place in washing machine and let harness air dry. DO NOT machine dry.
HELP EM UP THE EASY WAY - Brace and stabilize your pets weak hind legs after surgery or during rehabilitation, creating an easier life when climbing stairs or getting into the car.
GUARANTEE - Premium quality and USA tested to ensure satisfaction. If you are unhappy with the product for any reason simply return it for a 100% money back refund.
